00037 //
00038 // Simple thread implementation
00039 // This is enough for KVIrc needs
00040 // HANDLE WITH CARE
00041 //
00042 
00043 
00044 // Portability stuff
00045 
00046 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00047 
00048         #include <winsock2.h> // this will pull in windows.h and will avoid windock.h inclusion
00049         //#include <windows.h>
00050         // Windoze thread abstraction layer
00051         #define kvi_mutex_t HANDLE
00052         inline void kvi_threadMutexInit(kvi_mutex_t * _pMutex_t)
00053         {
00054                 *_pMutex_t = CreateMutex(0,0,NULL);
00055         }
00056         #define kvi_threadMutexLock(_pMutex_t) WaitForSingleObject(*_pMutex_t,INFINITE)
00057         #define kvi_threadMutexUnlock(_pMutex_t) ReleaseMutex(*_pMutex_t)
00058         #define kvi_threadMutexDestroy(_pMutex_t) CloseHandle(*_pMutex_t)
00059         inline bool kvi_threadMutexTryLock(kvi_mutex_t *_pMutex_t)
00060         {
00061                 return (WaitForSingleObject(*_pMutex_t,0) == WAIT_OBJECT_0);
00062         }
00063 
00064         #define kvi_thread_t HANDLE
00065 
00066         inline bool kvi_threadCreate(kvi_thread_t *t,LPTHREAD_START_ROUTINE start_routine,void * arg)
00067         {
00068                 DWORD dwThreadId;
00069                 *t = CreateThread(NULL,0,start_routine,arg,0,&dwThreadId);
00070                 return (*t != NULL);
00071         }
00072 
00073         #define kvi_threadExit() ExitThread(0)
00074 
00075 #else
00076         #ifdef COMPILE_THREADS_USE_POSIX
00077                 // Glibc pthread implementation
00078 
00079                 #include <pthread.h>
00080                 #include <errno.h> // for EBUSY
00081 
00082                 // Mutex stuff
00083                 #define kvi_mutex_t pthread_mutex_t
00084                 #define kvi_threadMutexInit(_pMutex_t) pthread_mutex_init(_pMutex_t,0)
00085                 #define kvi_threadMutexLock(_pMutex_t) pthread_mutex_lock(_pMutex_t)
00086                 #define kvi_threadMutexUnlock(_pMutex_t) pthread_mutex_unlock(_pMutex_t)
00087                 #define kvi_threadMutexDestroy(_pMutex_t) pthread_mutex_destroy(_pMutex_t)
00088                 inline bool kvi_threadMutexTryLock(kvi_mutex_t *_pMutex_t)
00089                 {
00090                         return (pthread_mutex_trylock(_pMutex_t) != EBUSY);
00091                 }
00092                 // Actually unused
00093                 // #define kvi_threadMutexTryLock(_pMutex_t) pthread_mutex_trylock(_pMutex_t)
00094 
00095                 // Thread stuff
00096                 #define kvi_thread_t pthread_t
00097 
00098                 inline bool kvi_threadCreate(kvi_thread_t *t,void * (*start_routine)(void *),void * arg)
00099                 {
00100                         pthread_attr_t a;
00101                         pthread_attr_init(&a);
00102                         pthread_attr_setinheritsched(&a,PTHREAD_INHERIT_SCHED);
00103                         pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&a,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00104 
00105                         int ret = pthread_create(t,&a,start_routine,arg);
00106 
00107                         pthread_attr_destroy(&a);
00108                         return (ret == 0);
00109                 }
00110 
00111                 // We don't care about exit codes at all
00112                 #define kvi_threadExit() pthread_exit(0)
00113         #else
00114                 #ifdef COMPILE_THREADS_USE_SOLARIS_LIBTHREAD
00115                         // Native solaris implementation
00116                         #include <thread.h>
00117                         #include <synch.h>
00118                         #include <errno.h>
00119 
00120                         // Mutex stuff
00121                         #define kvi_mutex_t mutex_t
00122                         #define kvi_threadMutexInit(_pMutex_t) mutex_init(_pMutex_t,0,0)
00123                         #define kvi_threadMutexLock(_pMutex_t) mutex_lock(_pMutex_t)
00124                         #define kvi_threadMutexUnlock(_pMutex_t) mutex_unlock(_pMutex_t)
00125                         #define kvi_threadMutexDestroy(_pMutex_t) mutex_destroy(_pMutex_t)
00126                         inline bool kvi_threadMutexTryLock(kvi_mutex_t *_pMutex_t)
00127                         {
00128                                 return (mutex_trylock(_pMutex_t) != EBUSY);
00129                         };
00130                         // Actually unused
00131                         // #define kvi_threadMutexTryLock(_pMutex_t) mutex_trylock(_pMutex_t)
00132 
00133                         // Thread stuff
00134                         #define kvi_thread_t thread_t
00135 
00136                         inline bool kvi_threadCreate(kvi_thread_t *t,void * (*start_routine)(void *),void *arg)
00137                         {
00138                                 return (thr_create(0,0,start_routine,arg,THR_DETACHED,t) == 0);
00139                         }
00140 
00141                         // We don't care about exit codes at all
00142                         #define kvi_threadExit() thr_exit(0)
00143                 #else
00144 // FIXME:                       #warning "Missing a decent thread implementation: we're going to fail, sorry!"
00145                 #endif
00146         #endif
00147 #endif
00148 
00149 class KVILIB_API KviMutex : public KviHeapObject
00150 {
00151 private:
00152         kvi_mutex_t m_mutex;
00153 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00154         bool        m_bLocked;
00155 #endif
00156 public:
00157         KviMutex(){ kvi_threadMutexInit(&m_mutex); };
00158         virtual ~KviMutex(){ kvi_threadMutexDestroy(&m_mutex); };
00159 public:
00160 #if defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) || defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00161         void lock(){ kvi_threadMutexLock(&m_mutex); m_bLocked = true; };
00162         void unlock(){ m_bLocked = false; kvi_threadMutexUnlock(&m_mutex); };
00163         bool locked(){ return m_bLocked; };
00164 #else
00165         void lock(){ kvi_threadMutexLock(&m_mutex); };
00166         void unlock(){ kvi_threadMutexUnlock(&m_mutex); };
00167         bool locked();
00168 #endif
00169 };

00171 
00172 // simple thread class implementation
00173 // this is also called "Blind" thread class
00174 
00175 class KVILIB_API KviThread : public KviHeapObject
00176 {
00177 public:
00178         KviThread();
00179         virtual ~KviThread();
00180 private:
00181         kvi_thread_t    m_thread;
00182         bool            m_bRunning;
00183         bool            m_bStartingUp;
00184         KviMutex      * m_pRunningMutex;
00185         KviPointerList<QEvent> * m_pLocalEventQueue;
00186 public:
00187         // public KviThread interface
00188         // HANDLE WITH CARE
00189 
00190         // Runs the thread...call only from external threads!!! :)
00191         // This function returns true if the child thread has been successfully created
00192         // this des not mean that run() is being already executed...
00193         // isStartingUp() will return true from this moment until
00194         // the child thread jumps into run() where it will be set to running state (isRunning() == true)
00195         // and removed from startingUp state.
00196         bool start();
00197         // Returns the state of the thread...safe to call from anywhere
00198         bool isRunning();
00199         // Returns the state of the thread...safe to call from anywhere
00200         bool isStartingUp(); // start() called, but not in run() yet...
00201         // Waits for the termination of this thread: call only from external threads!!! :)
00202         void wait();
00203         // DO NOT TOUCH THIS ONE!
00204         void internalThreadRun_doNotTouchThis();
00205 
00206         static void sleep(unsigned long sec);
00207         static void msleep(unsigned long msec);
00208         static void usleep(unsigned long usec);
00209 protected:
00210         // protected KviThread interface
00211         // HANDLE WITH CARE TOO!
00212 
00213         // Reimplement this with your job
00214         virtual void run(){};
00215         // Terminates the execution of the calling thread
00216         void exit();
00217         // The tricky part: threadsafe event dispatching
00218         // Slave thread -> main thread objects
00219         void postEvent(QObject *o,QEvent *e);
00220 private:
00221         void setRunning(bool bRunning);
00222         void setStartingUp(bool bStartingUp);
00223 };

00225 // QEvent::Type for Thread events
00226 #define KVI_THREAD_EVENT (((int)QEvent::User) + 2000)
00227 
00228 // CONSTANTS FOR KviThreadEvent::eventId();
00229 
00231 // extern -> slave thread
00232 
00233 // Your reimplementation of KviSensitiveThread MUST handle this
00234 // and exit when this event is received
00235 
00236 // Terminate is a plain KviThreadEvent
00237 #define KVI_THREAD_EVENT_TERMINATE 0
00238 
00240 // slave thread -> master object
00241 
00242 // The following standard events are sent from the thread to the master object
00243 
00244 // The following are plain KviThreadEvent objects
00245 #define KVI_THREAD_EVENT_SUCCESS 100
00246 
00247 // The following are KviThreadDataEvent<int>
00248 #define KVI_THREAD_EVENT_STATECHANGE 150
00249 
00250 // The following are KviThreadDataEvent<KviStr>
00251 #define KVI_THREAD_EVENT_MESSAGE 200
00252 #define KVI_THREAD_EVENT_WARNING 201
00253 #define KVI_THREAD_EVENT_ERROR 202
00254 #define KVI_THREAD_EVENT_DATA 203
00255 
00256 // The following is KviThreadDataEvent<KviDataBuffer>
00257 #define KVI_THREAD_EVENT_BINARYDATA 300
00258 
00259 // The user events
00260 #define KVI_THREAD_USER_EVENT_BASE 1000
00261 
00262 // #warning "Get rid of the m_szMessage member of KviThreadEvent : eventual data should be passed with a KviThreadDataEvent"
00263 
00264 // Base class for all thread events
00265 class KVILIB_API KviThreadEvent : public QEvent, public KviHeapObject
00266 {
00267 protected:
00268         int         m_eventId;
00269         KviThread * m_pSender;
00270 public:
00271         KviThreadEvent(int evId,KviThread * sender = 0)
00272                 : QEvent((QEvent::Type)KVI_THREAD_EVENT), m_eventId(evId), m_pSender(sender) {};
00273         virtual ~KviThreadEvent(){};
00274 public:
00275         // This is the sender of the event
00276         // WARNING : this MAY be null, threads CAN send anonymous events
00277         KviThread * sender(){ return m_pSender; };
00278         int id(){ return m_eventId; };
00279 };
00280 
00281 template<class TData> class KviThreadDataEvent : public KviThreadEvent
00282 {
00283 protected:
00284         TData * m_pData;
00285 public:
00286         KviThreadDataEvent(int evId,TData * pData = 0,KviThread * sender = 0)
00287                 : KviThreadEvent(evId,sender){ m_pData = pData; };
00288         virtual ~KviThreadDataEvent(){ if(m_pData)delete m_pData; };
00289 public:
00290         void setData(TData * d){ if(m_pData)delete m_pData; m_pData = d; };
00291         TData * getData(){ TData * aux = m_pData; m_pData = 0; return aux; };
00292         TData * data(){ return m_pData; };
00293 };
00294 
00295 // A thread that has also an internal event queue
00296 // so events can be posted from the master side to the slave one
00297 // Reimplementations of this class should periodically check
00298 // dequeueEvent() and eventually process the incoming events (and then DELETE it)
00299 
00300 // KVI_THREAD_EVENT_TERMINATE should be always handled by the reimplementation
00301 // and it should always exit (cleanly) when this event is received
00302 
00303 
00304 class KVILIB_API KviSensitiveThread : public KviThread
00305 {
00306 public:
00307         KviSensitiveThread();
00308         virtual ~KviSensitiveThread();
00309 protected:
00310         KviMutex              * m_pLocalEventQueueMutex;
00311         KviPointerList<KviThreadEvent> * m_pLocalEventQueue;
00312 public:
00313         // enqueues an event directed to THIS thread
00314         // the event must be allocated with NEW and
00315         // will be destroyed on the slave side
00316         void enqueueEvent(KviThreadEvent *e);
00317         // enqueues a terminate event and waits() for the slave thread
00318         // the slave thread MUST handle KVI_THREAD_EVENT_TERMINATE
00319         void terminate();
00320 protected:
00321         // slave side:
00322         // returns the first event in the local queue
00323         // the event MUST BE DELETED after processing
00324         KviThreadEvent * dequeueEvent();
00325 };

00331 typedef struct _KviThreadPendingEvent
00332 {
00333         QObject *o;
00334         QEvent *e;
00335 } KviThreadPendingEvent;

00337 class KVILIB_API KviThreadManager : public QObject
00338 {
00339         friend class KviApp;
00340         friend class KviThread;
00341         Q_OBJECT
00342 protected:
00343         // These should be private...but we don't want anyone to complain
00344         // Treat as private plz.
00345         KviThreadManager();
00346         ~KviThreadManager();
00347 public:
00348         static void killPendingEvents(QObject * receiver);
00349 private:
00350 #if !defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) && !defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00351         QSocketNotifier * m_pSn;
00352 #endif
00353         KviMutex * m_pMutex; // This class performs only atomic operations
00354         KviPointerList<KviThread> * m_pThreadList;
00355         int m_iWaitingThreads;
00356 #if !defined(COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS) && !defined(COMPILE_ON_MINGW)
00357         KviPointerList<KviThreadPendingEvent> * m_pEventQueue;
00358         int m_fd[2];
00359         int m_iTriggerCount;
00360 #endif
00361 protected:
00362         // Public to KviThread only
00363         void registerSlaveThread(KviThread *t);
00364         void unregisterSlaveThread(KviThread *t);
00365 
00366         void threadEnteredWaitState();
00367         void threadLeftWaitState();
00368 
00369         void postSlaveEvent(QObject *o,QEvent *e);
00370         void killPendingEventsByReceiver(QObject * receiver);
00371         // Public to KviApp only
00372         static void globalInit();
00373         static void globalDestroy();
00374 private slots:
00375         void eventsPending(int fd);
00376 };
